trans-unit.source: Obtains the file locations and descriptions of ASP.NET Web services.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractSearchPattern> class inherits from the abstract <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoverySearchPattern> class and is employed by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler> class's <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler.ProcessRequest%2A> method, which handles an HTTP request for a discovery document.
Normally, none of these classes need to be used directly by a developer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractSearchPattern"></xref> class.
Creates the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractReference"></xref> object for the specified .asmx file.
The concrete <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractReference> class inherits from the abstract <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference> class.

A <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractReference> instance contains the location of the .asmx file and the corresponding Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document, which can be dynamically obtained by appending a wsdl query string to the .asmx file path.
The file-system path of the Web service's .asmx file.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractReference"></xref> object with the specified file name for its .asmx file.
Gets the file name pattern to use as a search target.
The pattern "*.asmx" indicates an ASP.NET Web service file extension.
